title: 286-A
statement: A. Lucky Permutationtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutA permutationpof sizenis the sequencep1,p2, ...,pn, consisting ofndistinct integers, each of them is from1ton(1 ≤pi≤n).A lucky permutation is such permutationp, that any integeri(1 ≤i≤n)meets this conditionppi=n-i+ 1.You have integern. Find some lucky permutationpof sizen.InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 105) — the required permutation size.OutputPrint "-1" (without the quotes) if the lucky permutationpof sizendoesn't exist.Otherwise, printndistinct integersp1,p2, ...,pn(1 ≤pi≤n)after a space — the required permutation.If there are multiple answers, you can print any of them.ExamplesInput1Output1Input2Output-1Input4Output2 4 1 3Input5Output2 5 3 1 4

processed.result:
You are given an integer $n$.  

A permutation of size $n$ is a sequence of $n$ distinct integers from 1 to $n$.  A lucky permutation is a permutation where for every integer $i$ from 1 to $n$, the $i$th element in the permutation is equal to $n-i+1$.

Your task is to:

1. Determine if a lucky permutation of size $n$ exists.
2. If it exists, print one such permutation.
3. If it doesn't exist, print "-1".

Given a number *n*, find a sequence of *n* unique numbers from 1 to *n* where each number's position in the sequence is equal to *n - (position of the number) + 1*. If such a sequence exists, print it. Otherwise, print "-1".
